competencies.name: Operative selects correct personal protective equipment for undertaking duties as a Skip Waste Minimisation Operative
Operative maintains cleanliness of the site to minimise the risk of incidents or accidents
Operative uses pedestrian safe zones when moving around the site

sections.name: B - Work Process: Accepting waste and recyclable materials

competencies.name: Operative directs site users to ensure compliance with site rules and access requirements
competencies.supportingText:
Operative identifies non-conforming materials and takes relevant action in accordance with organisational procedures
  1. What action would you take if there are non-conforming materials in a load arriving on site?

competencies.name: Operative directs site users to the correct locations for depositing waste and recyclable materials
Operative inspects waste and recyclables arriving on site to verify it complies with permit conditions
competencies.supportingText:
Operative reports all accidents, incidents of damage and near misses to supervisor as soon as possible
  1. What is the organisational procedure for reporting accidents and near misses?
  2. What is the organisational procedure for reporting damage?

competencies.name: Operative correctly completes documentation for incoming loads of waste and recyclable materials
Operative identifies non-conforming materials and takes relevant action in accordance with organisational procedures
competencies.supportingText:
Operative follows organisational procedure for dealing with plant, equipment or vehicle breakdowns
  1. What is the organisational procedure for dealing with:-Plant breakdowns-Equipment breakdowns-Vehicle breakdowns

competencies.name: Operative ensures incoming loads are tipped in the correct tipping-bay area for the type of material
Operative reports all accidents, incidents of damage and near misses to supervisor as soon as possible
competencies.supportingText:
Operative identifies non-conforming materials in the tipping-bay area and takes relevant action in accordance with organisational procedures
  1. What action would you take if there are non-conforming materials in the tipping bay area?

competencies.name: Operative performs routine maintenance activities to avoid unnecessary equipment down time
Operative follows organisational procedures for dealing with plant, equipment or vehicle breakdowns

sections.name: C - Work Process: Sorting waste and recyclable materials

competencies.name: Operative identifies selected materials in the tipping-bay area
Operative identifies non-conforming materials in the tipping-bay area and takes relevant action in accordance with organisational procedures
Operative picks selected materials in the tipping-bay area in accordance with risk assessments produced for this activity
Operative drops selected materials into the correct containers for waste and recyclables
Operative notifies relevant person(s) when waste containers are almost full
Operative follows organisational procedure to facilitate the safe change over of containers
competencies.supportingText:
Operative identifies hazards in adverse weather conditions such as leaves, snow, water and ice
  1. What are the hazards related to snow and ice conditions?
  2. What are the hazards related to leaves?
  3. What are the hazards related to excess water?

competencies.name: Operative follows organisational procedures to minimise emissions (e.g. dust, noise, odour, litter or vermin) from the site
competencies.supportingText:
Operative carries out treatment appropriate for the hazardous condition:
  1. How would you treat surfaces for snow?
    2. Ice? Leaves? Water?
  2. How would you unblock drains on site?
  3. Why is this important?

competencies.name: Operative arranges for remaining waste to be transported off site or treated on site once sorting is complete
competencies.supportingText:
Operative informs relevant person(s) in the event of worsening conditions
  1. Who should be informed?
  2. Why is this important?

competencies.name: Operative correctly completes documentation for outgoing loads of waste and recyclable materials

sections.name: D - Work Process: Adverse weather conditions

competencies.name: Operative identifies hazards in adverse weather conditions such as leaves, snow, water and ice
Operative carries out treatment appropriate for the hazardous condition
Operative informs relevant person(s) in the event of worsening conditions
competencies.supportingText:
Operative assists with opening and closure of tipping hall to specified times and following procedure
  1. What is the organisational procedure for opening and closing the site?
  2. What are the permit conditions for opening and closing the site?
